Philip Tucker wrote:

>>
>>We handled this in our floating eye shape evaluator by giving each
>>individual the same number of CPU cycles (appoximately).  So, the larger the
>>neural network grows, the fewer number of activation cycles it receives.
>>This servers to keep all individuals on the same footing, giving each the
>>same amount of CPU resources, and also mitigates bloat.
>>
>>- Philip
>>    
>>
Good point. Also an alternative is to factor CPU usage into the fitness 
score.

Colin.
